{{for|the Swedish physicist|Carl Nordling}}
__NOTOC__
'''Carl O. Nordling''' (1919 – February 15, 2007) was a [[Finnish people|Finnish]] born [[architect]], [[urban planning|urban planner]] and amateur [[historian]]. He graduated as an architect from the [[Helsinki University of Technology]] in 1939<ref>[http://www.carlonordling.se/carl.html Who is Carl O. Nordling?] ([[Who’s Who in the World]])</ref> and immigrated to [[Sweden]] after the end of the [[Continuation War]] in 1944. Nordling published an article on the [[Holocaust]], ''How Many Jews Died in the German Concentration Camps?'', in the [[Holocaust denial]] publication [[Journal of Historical Review]].<ref>[http://www.revisionists.com/revisionists/nordling.html Carl O. Nordling at Revisionists.com]</ref>

Nordling has also published an article entitled [http://www.carlonordling.se/ww2/didstalin.html Did Stalin deliver his alleged speech of 19 August 1939?] in the [[Journal of Slavic Military Studies]].

As a [[statistician]], he applied statistical methods to a number of scientific problems and published a large number of articles, mainly in his native Swedish. His most notable work is in scientific disciplines outside his professional expertise. Internationally he is best known for the small number of papers he published in English language [[peer review]]ed scientific journals.

In 1953, in a paper published in the ''[[British Journal of Cancer]]'',<ref>[http://www.nature.com/milestones/milecancer/full/milecancer09.html Milestone 9: (1953) Two-hit hypothesis - It takes (at least) two to tango] - at [[nature.com]]</ref> he first proposed the [[multi-mutation theory on cancer]], today generally known as ''Knudson hypothesis'' after [[Alfred G. Knudson]]'s work from 1971.

In his later years he wrote mainly about issues in Nordic and Germanic history, contributing among other to the [[Shakespeare authorship question|debate on Shakespeare's identity]] <ref>[http://www.carlonordling.se/shakespeare/shakespeare.html Shakespeare: Who wrote Hamlet and why?]</ref>

== Publications ==

=== Books ===
* ''Gåtorna kring Birger jarl, Ösel och Borgå: Omvärdering av historiska teorier rörande svensk östpolitik och finsk och estnisk kolonisation under tidig medeltid'' Faktainformation (1976) ISBN 978-91-85494-00-2
* ''Den svenske Runeberg'' Ekenäs tryckeri aktiebolags förlag (1988) ISBN 978-951-9001-20-3

=== Journals ===
* ''[http://www.carlonordling.se/Cancer.html A New Theory on the Cancer-inducing Mechanism]'', ''The [[British Journal of Cancer]]'', 1953, Vol. VII, p. 68-72.
* ''[http://www.ihr.org/jhr/v10/v10p195_Nordling.html The Jewish Establishment Under Nazi Threat and Domination 1938-1945]'' - ''[[The Journal of Historical Review]], volume 10 no. 2 (Summer 1990), p. 195.
* ''[http://www.ihr.org/jhr/v11/v11p335_Nordling.html How Many Jews Died in the German Concentration Camps?]'' - ''The Journal of Historical Review'', volume 11 no. 3 (Fall 1991), p. 335.
* ''[http://select.ingentaconnect.com/titles/scup/03468755/v23n1/contp1-1.htm The Location of the "Birca" - The Missionary Station of Bishop Ansgar]'' - in the ''[[Scandinavian Journal of History]]'', Volume 23 Number 1/2 1998
* ''The Death of Karl XII.(18th-century Swedish king)'' - in ''[[Scandinavian Studies]]'', Volume 71 Number 1; Spring 1999
* ''[http://www.ceeol.com/aspx/getdocument.aspx?logid=5&id=cad9ae24-4938-11d9-a4c1-0040056dff65 Was There a Finnish Settlement in Uusimaa before the Swedish One?]'' at ''[[Linguistica Uralica]]'' (2/2004)
* ''[http://www.carlonordling.se/ww2/didstalin.html Did Stalin deliver his alleged speech of 19 August 1939?]'', in ''[[Journal of Slavic Military Studies]]'', 19:93-106, 2006.
